question: According to data from the last 13 years, the most women were naturalized in 2017.
content: 6,318 people, the largest number of women, were naturalized in 2017.

question: In the Satakunta region, most men were naturalized in 2011.
content: The fewest men were naturalized in 2011 with 18 men.

question: In the Ostrobothnia region, the number of men naturalized in 2015 was greater than the number of women.
content: In 2015, 174 women and 152 men were naturalized.

question: The same number of men have been naturalized in the Kainuu region for three consecutive years.
content: From 2016 to 2018, 33 men were naturalized every year for three years.

question: The Central Ostrobothnia region was the region that gave the most citizenship among all regions in 2011.
content: The Central Ostrobothnia region was the region that gave the least citizenship in 2011.

question: In the Satakunta region, the number of naturalized men has always been greater than the number of women.
content: On the contrary, the number of men granted citizenship has always been greater than the number of women.

question: The fewest men in all of Finland were naturalized in 2010.
The number of naturalized women and men in the Pirkanmaa region has always been different.
content: In the Pirkanmaa region, the number of people granted citizenship has never been equal.

question: The number of men naturalized in the Kymenlaakso region has increased every year.
In the South Karelia region, the number of women naturalized has always been greater than the number of men.
content: True, there has always been too much.
